Staging Process

  • Initiation

The staging process enables the associate to systematically locate customer pickup or ship-to-store orders prior to confirm pickup. When a customer arrives to pick the order, the staging location(s) where the inventory resides are presented to the associate to aid in locating the order. This can help reduce pickup transaction times and improve customer service.

Staging is relatively easier to implement as it does not require locations to be predefined in the system. Depending on the retailer's needs, staging locations can follow relatively simple (i.e., "Behind counter 1") or complex naming conventions and can exist in barcoded or human readable formats.

Staging is an optional process for both pickup and ship-to-store orders.

To know more on the staging activity during offline mode, please refer to the Store Offline Support page.

Initiation

For pickup orders, associates can perform staging during picking or later using the Stage Pickups menu option. For ship to store orders, staging can be done during receiving or later using the Stage Pickups menu option.

Through staging, the associate captures the staging location of the package/order.

Pickup orders

Staging for pickup orders is initiated from the list of ready to stage orders. If staging is not done immediately after Picking, the store associates can initiate staging from the ready to stage order list. Alternatively, one of the following search criteria can be used to lookup order(s) to stage:

  • PicklistId
  • OrderId
  • FulfillmentId
  • ItemId

The staging list for pickup orders is displayed based on the parameter "Stage Pickup - Display all fulfillments ready for staging". Refer to Staging Configuration.

Ready to stage orders list displays pickup orders in "Picked" status. "Not staged" orders are listed first in the ascending order of picked date and time, followed by staged orders in descending order of picked date and time. Staged orders are displayed so that the staging location can be changed if needed. The same sorting logic is applicable to the ready-to-stage list when the pick-to-slot parameter "Pick to slot for pickups " is turned on. Refer to Picking Configuration.

Picker's first & last names are also available on the list for each order. If the first name and/or the last name is/are not configured, then the userId is displayed. Associate can select the order from the list and stage. "listFulfillmentsForStaging"  API is used to list pickup orders for staging.

Print all pickup slips option is available after the search criterion is applied. Print all pickup slips option is controlled by permission.

Since the staging process is optional for pickup orders, associates can choose to stage some or all of the picked orders, or can choose not to stage any orders.

Search Options for Staging List

Search can be performed by entering or scanning the Item / Item barcode, OrderId, Fulfillment Id or PicklistId. OrderId is available on the pickup slip, so if the pickup slip is already printed, the associate can enter the OrderId to stage. 

Search By Picklist 

For pickup orders, staging can be initiated at the picklist level. Once a picklist is selected, associates can stage the orders on the picklist. This is achieved with the List Fulfillments for Staging service, which returns a list of orders on the picklist. Once a list of orders is returned, associates perform staging for each order they would like to stage. The picklist must be completed for the picklist orders to be eligible for staging. If the picklist is slotted, the slot information is also presented to the associate.

Associates can immediately stage orders as picking is completed for a picklist, or can choose to stage orders for the picklist at a later time.

Since the staging process is optional for pickup orders, associates can choose to stage some or all of the orders on a picklist, or can choose not to stage any orders on the picklist.

If the "Stage Pickup - Display all fulfillments ready for staging" parameter is turned off, PicklistId is needed to start the staging process if staging is not done immediately after Picking through the interstitial.

Search By Order 

For pickup orders, staging can be initiated at the order or fulfillment level. Associates can search for the order or fulfillment from the ready-to-stage list and stage. This is achieved with the List Fulfillments for Staging service, which returns the corresponding fulfillment(s), if valid for staging. Once the fulfillment(s) are returned, associates can perform staging. If the fulfillment(s) are slotted, the slot information is also presented to the associate. If a valid fulfillment is not returned, then the appropriate message is displayed. 

Associates can immediately stage an order as soon as picking is completed, or can choose to stage at a later time.

Search By Item 

For pickup orders, staging can be initiated at the Item level. Associates can search for the orders containing a particular item, from a ready-to-stage list and stage. This is achieved with the List Fulfillments for Staging service, which returns the order(s) containing the item, if valid for staging. Once the orders are returned, associates can perform staging with one order at a time. If the orders are slotted, the slot information is also presented to the associate. If a valid order is not returned, then the appropriate message is displayed.

Associates can immediately stage an order as soon as picking is completed, or can choose to stage orders at a later time based on item search. 

Ship-to-store orders

For ship-to-store orders, staging is initiated at the package level. Associates may invoke staging from the receiving UI, or can choose to stage the package at a later time after receiving has occurred. Staging screen lists all the pickup fulfillments that are not yet picked up. If an associate chooses to stage the ship-to-store order from the receiving interstitial screen, the list of orders for which a package was just received is displayed to the user to facilitate staging. Refer to the Receiving process guide for additional information. A complete list of ready-to-stage ship-to-store pickup fulfillments can also be accessed anytime as needed.

Alternatively, based on the parameter "Stage Ship to store - Display all fulfillments ready for staging", store associate can view the ready-to-stage ship-to-store pickup fulfillments list. This list also displays pickup leg fulfillments in "Created" status. Refer to Staging Configuration for more details about the parameter. "Not staged" orders are displayed first in the ascending order of received date and time (i.e. Picked date and time updated on Fulfillment Audit), followed by "Staged" orders in the desending order of received date and time. Ship to store pickup fulfillments can be staged from the list or a specific order can be searched using PackageId.

The scanned package and other packages belonging to the same pickup fulfillment must be in 'Received' status to stage the package. Fulfillment details are shown to the associate. When another package for the same pickup fulfillment is scanned, any existing staging locations are also displayed to help the associates stage them at the same place if possible.

The scanned package and other packages belonging to the same pickup fulfillment must be in 'Received' status to stage the package. Fulfillment details are shown to the associate. When another package for the same pickup fulfillment is scanned, any existing staging locations are also displayed to help the associates stage them at the same place if possible.

Staging

For both pickup and ship-to-store orders, the associate enters one or more staging locations for the selected order. Multiple locations can be specified for an order if the inventory must be placed in multiple locations. Multiple orders can also be staged in the same staging location.

Once staged, associates can change the staging location(s) assigned to an order prior to customer pickup, provided the Picklist /Package is known for pickup / ship-to-store fulfillments respectively.

Note: If the order has not been staged, at least 1 location is required to enable the 'Submit' button.
Updates

The Update Fulfillment service (for pickup orders) or Stage Ship-to-Store Orders service (for ship-to-store orders) updates the staging location(s) for the fulfillment. The fulfillment status is not updated by the staging process.
